00050 /*
00051  *  osd_iam.h
00052  */
00053 #ifndef CLASSERT
00054 #define CLASSERT(cond) do {switch(42) {case (cond): case 0: break;}} while (0)
00055 #endif
00056 /* implication */
00057 #define ergo(a, b) (!(a) || (b))
00058 /* logical equivalence */
00059 #define equi(a, b) (!!(a) == !!(b))
00060 
00061 enum {
00062         /*
00063          * Maximal number of non-leaf levels in htree. In the stock ldiskfs this
00064          * is 2.
00065          */
00066         /*
00067          * XXX reduced back to 2 to make per-node locking work.
00068          */
00069         DX_MAX_TREE_HEIGHT = 5,
00070         /*
00071          * Scratch keys used by generic code for temporaries.
00072          *
00073          * Allocation:
00074          *
00075          *         [0] reserved for assertions and as a staging area for
00076          *         record keys immediately used for key comparisons.
00077          *
00078          *         [1] reserved for record key, stored during iteration over
00079          *         node records (see dx_node_check()).
00080          *
00081          *         [2] reserved for leaf node operations.
00082          *
00083          *         [3] reserved for index operations.
00084          *
00085          *         [4] reserved for path->ip_ikey_target
00086          *
00087          */
00088         DX_SCRATCH_KEYS    = 5,
00089         /*
00090          * Maximal format name length.
00091          */
00092         DX_FMT_NAME_LEN    = 16,
00093 };

00097  * Debugging.

00100  */

00102 #if 0
00103 /*
00104  * Following macros are defined in config.h and are tunable through
00105  * appropriate configure switches (indicated below).
00106  */
00107 
00108 /*
00109  * Compile basic assertions in. You want this most of the time.
00110  *
00111  * --{enable,disable}-ldiskfs-assert (on by default).
00112  */
00113 #define LDISKFS_ASSERT (1)
00114 
00115 /*
00116  * Compile heavier correctness checks in. You want this during development
00117  * cycle.
00118  *
00119  * --{enable,disable}-ldiskfs-correctness (off by default).
00120  */
00121 #define LDISKFS_CORRECTNESS (1)
00122 
00123 /*
00124  * Compile heavy invariant checking in. You want this early during development
00125  * or when chasing a bug.
00126  *
00127  * --{enable,disable}-ldiskfs-invariant (off by default).
00128  */
00129 #define LDISKFS_INVARIANT (1)
00130 #endif
00131 
00132 #if defined(LDISKFS_ASSERT)
00133 #define LDISKFS_ASSERT_ON (1)
00134 #else
00135 #define LDISKFS_ASSERT_ON (0)
00136 #endif
00137 
00138 #if defined(LDISKFS_CORRECTNESS)
00139 #define LDISKFS_CORRECTNESS_ON (1)
00140 #else
00141 #define LDISKFS_CORRECTNESS_ON (0)
00142 #endif
00143 
00144 #if defined(LDISKFS_INVARIANT)
00145 #define LDISKFS_INVARIANT_ON (1)
00146 #else
00147 #define LDISKFS_INVARIANT_ON (0)
00148 #endif
00149 
00150 #ifndef assert
00151 #if LDISKFS_ASSERT_ON
00152 #define assert(test) J_ASSERT(test)
00153 #else
00154 #define assert(test) ((void)(test))
00155 #endif
00156 #endif
00157 
00158 #if LDISKFS_CORRECTNESS_ON
00159 #define assert_corr(test) J_ASSERT(test)
00160 #define do_corr(exp) exp
00161 #else
00162 #define assert_corr(test) do {;} while (0)
00163 #define do_corr(exp) do {;} while (0)
00164 #endif
00165 
00166 #if LDISKFS_INVARIANT_ON
00167 #define assert_inv(test) J_ASSERT(test)
00168 #else
00169 #define assert_inv(test) do {;} while (0)

00172 /*
00173  * Entry within index tree node. Consists of a key immediately followed
00174  * (without padding) by a pointer to the child node.
00175  *
00176  * Both key and pointer are of variable size, hence incomplete type.
00177  */
00178 struct iam_entry;
00179 
00180 struct iam_entry_compat {
00181         __le32 hash;
00182         __le32 block;
00183 };
00184 
00185 /*
00186  * Incomplete type used to refer to keys in iam container.
00187  *
00188  * As key size can be different from container to container, iam has to use
00189  * incomplete type. Clients cast pointer to iam_key to real key type and back.
00190  */
00191 struct iam_key;
00192 
00193 /*
00194  * Incomplete type use to refer to the records stored in iam containers.
00195  */
00196 struct iam_rec;
00197 
00198 /*
00199  * Key in index node. Possibly compressed. Fixed size.
00200  */
00201 struct iam_ikey;
00202 
00203 /*
00204  * Scalar type into which certain iam_key's can be uniquely mapped. Used to
00205  * support interfaces like readdir(), where iteration over index has to be
00206  * re-startable.
00207  */
00208 typedef __u32 iam_ptr_t;
00209 
00210 /*
00211  * Index node traversed during tree lookup.
00212  */
00213 struct iam_frame {
00214         struct buffer_head *bh;    /* buffer holding node data */
00215         struct iam_entry *entries; /* array of entries */
00216         struct iam_entry *at;      /* target entry, found by binary search */
00217         iam_ptr_t         leaf;    /* (logical) offset of child node found by
00218                                     * binary search. */
00219         iam_ptr_t         curidx;  /* (logical) offset of this node. Used to
00220                                     * per-node locking to detect concurrent
00221                                     * splits. */
00222         unsigned int      at_shifted:1; /* The "at" entry has moved to next
00223                                          * because of shrinking index node
00224                                          * for recycling empty leaf node. */
00225 };
00226 
00227 /*
00228  * Opaque entry in the leaf node.
00229  */
00230 struct iam_lentry;
00231 
00232 struct iam_path;
00233 struct iam_container;
00234 
00235 
00236 /* leaf node reached by tree lookup */
00237 struct iam_leaf {
00238         struct iam_path    *il_path;
00239         struct buffer_head *il_bh;
00240         struct iam_lentry  *il_entries;
00241         struct iam_lentry  *il_at;
00242         /*
00243          * Lock on a leaf node.
00244          */
00245         struct dynlock_handle *il_lock;
00246         iam_ptr_t              il_curidx; /* logical offset of leaf node. */
00247         void               *il_descr_data;
00248 };
00249 
00250 /*
00251  * Return values of ->lookup() operation from struct iam_leaf_operations.
00252  */
00253 enum iam_lookup_t {
00254         /*
00255          * lookup found a record with the key requested
00256          */
00257         IAM_LOOKUP_EXACT  = 0,
00258         /*
00259          * lookup positioned leaf on some record
00260          */
00261         IAM_LOOKUP_OK     = 1,
00262         /*
00263          * leaf was empty
00264          */
00265         IAM_LOOKUP_EMPTY  = 2,
00266         /*
00267          * lookup positioned leaf before first record
00268          */
00269         IAM_LOOKUP_BEFORE = 3,
00270         /*
00271          * Found hash may have a continuation in the next leaf.
00272          */
00273         IAM_LOOKUP_LAST   = 0x100
00274 };
00275 
00276 /*
00277  * Format-specific container operations. These are called by generic iam code.
00278  */
00279 struct iam_operations {
00280         /*
00281          * Returns pointer (in the same sense as pointer in index entry) to
00282          * the root node.
00283          */
00284         __u32 (*id_root_ptr)(struct iam_container *c);
00285 
00286         /*
00287          * Check validity and consistency of index node.
00288          */
00289         int (*id_node_check)(struct iam_path *path, struct iam_frame *frame);
00290         /*
00291          * Copy some data from node header into frame. This is called when
00292          * new node is loaded into frame.
00293          */
00294         int (*id_node_load)(struct iam_path *path, struct iam_frame *frame);
00295         /*
00296          * Initialize new node (stored in @bh) that is going to be added into
00297          * tree.
00298          */
00299         int (*id_node_init)(struct iam_container *c,
00300                             struct buffer_head *bh, int root);
00301         int (*id_node_read)(struct iam_container *c, iam_ptr_t ptr,
00302                             handle_t *h, struct buffer_head **bh);
00303         /*
00304          * Key comparison functions. Returns -1, 0, +1.
00305          */
00306         int (*id_ikeycmp)(const struct iam_container *c,
00307                           const struct iam_ikey *k1,
00308                           const struct iam_ikey *k2);
00309         /*
00310          * Modify root node when tree height increases.
00311          */
00312         struct iam_entry *(*id_root_inc)(struct iam_container *c,
00313                                          struct iam_path *path,
00314                                          struct iam_frame *frame);
00315 
00316         struct iam_path_descr *(*id_ipd_alloc)(const struct iam_container *c,
00317                                                void *area);
00318         void (*id_ipd_free)(struct iam_path_descr *ipd);
00319         /*
00320          * Format name.
00321          */
00322         char id_name[DX_FMT_NAME_LEN];
00323 };
00324 
00325 /*
00326  * Another format-specific operation vector, consisting of methods to access
00327  * leaf nodes. This is separated from struct iam_operations, because it is
00328  * assumed that there will be many formats with different format of leaf
00329  * nodes, yes the same struct iam_operations.
00330  */
00331 struct iam_leaf_operations {
00332                 /*
00333                  * leaf operations.
00334                  */
00335 
00336         /*
00337          * initialize just loaded leaf node.
00338          */
00339         int (*init)(struct iam_leaf *p);
00340         /*
00341          * Format new node.
00342          */
00343         void (*init_new)(struct iam_container *c, struct buffer_head *bh);
00344         /*
00345          * Release resources.
00346          */
00347         void (*fini)(struct iam_leaf *l);
00348                 /*
00349                  * returns true iff leaf is positioned at the last entry.
00350                  */
00351         int (*at_end)(const struct iam_leaf *l);
00352                 /* position leaf at the first entry */
00353         void (*start)(struct iam_leaf *l);
00354                 /* more leaf to the next entry. */
00355         void (*next)(struct iam_leaf *l);
00356         /*
00357          * return key of current leaf record. This method may return
00358          * either pointer to the key stored in node, or copy key into
00359          * @k buffer supplied by caller and return pointer to this
00360          * buffer. The latter approach is used when keys in nodes are
00361          * not stored in plain form (e.g., htree doesn't store keys at
00362          * all).
00363          *
00364          * Caller should assume that returned pointer is only valid
00365          * while leaf node is pinned and locked.
00366          */
00367         struct iam_ikey *(*ikey)(const struct iam_leaf *l, struct iam_ikey *k);
00368         struct iam_key *(*key)(const struct iam_leaf *l);
00369         /* return pointer to entry body. Pointer is valid while
00370            corresponding leaf node is locked and pinned. */
00371         struct iam_rec *(*rec)(const struct iam_leaf *l);
00372 
00373         void (*key_set)(struct iam_leaf *l, const struct iam_key *k);
00374         void (*rec_set)(struct iam_leaf *l, const struct iam_rec *r);
00375         void (*rec_get)(const struct iam_leaf *l, struct iam_rec *r);
00376 
00377         int (*key_cmp)(const struct iam_leaf *l, const struct iam_key *k);
00378         int (*key_eq)(const struct iam_leaf *l, const struct iam_key *k);
00379 
00380         int (*rec_eq)(const struct iam_leaf *l, const struct iam_rec *r);
00381 
00382         int (*key_size)(const struct iam_leaf *l);
00383         /*
00384          * Search leaf @l for a record with key @k or for a place
00385          * where such record is to be inserted.
00386          *
00387          * Scratch keys from @path can be used.
00388          */
00389         int (*lookup)(struct iam_leaf *l, const struct iam_key *k);
00390         int (*ilookup)(struct iam_leaf *l, const struct iam_ikey *ik);
00391 
00392         int (*can_add)(const struct iam_leaf *l,
00393                        const struct iam_key *k, const struct iam_rec *r);
00394         /*
00395          * add rec for a leaf
00396          */
00397         void (*rec_add)(struct iam_leaf *l,
00398                         const struct iam_key *k, const struct iam_rec *r);
00399         /*
00400          * remove rec for a leaf
00401          */
00402         void (*rec_del)(struct iam_leaf *l, int shift);
00403         /*
00404          * split leaf node, moving some entries into @bh (the latter currently
00405          * is assumed to be empty).
00406          */
00407         void (*split)(struct iam_leaf *l, struct buffer_head **bh,
00408                       iam_ptr_t newblknr);
00409         /*
00410          * the leaf is empty?
00411          */
00412         int (*leaf_empty)(struct iam_leaf *l);
00413 };
00414 
00415 /*
00416  * Parameters, describing a flavor of iam container.
00417  */
00418 struct iam_descr {
00419         /*
00420          * Size of a key in this container, in bytes.
00421          */
00422          size_t       id_key_size;
00423         /*
00424          * Size of a key in index nodes, in bytes.
00425          */
00426          size_t       id_ikey_size;
00427         /*
00428          * Size of a pointer to the next level (stored in index nodes), in
00429          * bytes.
00430          */
00431         size_t       id_ptr_size;
00432         /*
00433          * Size of a record (stored in leaf nodes), in bytes.
00434          */
00435         size_t       id_rec_size;
00436         /*
00437          * Size of unused (by iam) space at the beginning of every non-root
00438          * node, in bytes. Used for compatibility with ldiskfs.
00439          */
00440         size_t       id_node_gap;
00441         /*
00442          * Size of unused (by iam) space at the beginning of root node, in
00443          * bytes. Used for compatibility with ldiskfs.
00444          */
00445         size_t       id_root_gap;
00446 
00447         struct iam_operations           *id_ops;
00448         struct iam_leaf_operations      *id_leaf_ops;
00449 };
00450 
00451 enum {
00452         IAM_IDLE_HEADER_MAGIC = 0x7903,
00453 };
00454 
00455 /*
00456  * Header structure to record idle blocks.
00457  */
00458 struct iam_idle_head {
00459         __le16 iih_magic;
00460         __le16 iih_count; /* how many idle blocks in this head */
00461         __le32 iih_next; /* next head for idle blocks */
00462         __le32 iih_blks[0];
00463 };
00464 
00465 /*
00466  * An instance of iam container.
00467  */
00468 struct iam_container {
00469         /*
00470          * Underlying flat file. IO against this object is issued to
00471          * read/write nodes.
00472          */
00473         struct inode        *ic_object;
00474         /*
00475          * BH of root block
00476          */
00477         struct buffer_head  *ic_root_bh;
00478         /*
00479          * container flavor.
00480          */
00481         struct iam_descr    *ic_descr;
00482         /*
00483          * read-write lock protecting index consistency.
00484          */
00485         struct rw_semaphore     ic_sem;
00486         struct dynlock       ic_tree_lock;
00487         /* Protect ic_idle_bh */
00488         struct mutex         ic_idle_mutex;
00489         /*
00490          * BH for idle blocks
00491          */
00492         struct buffer_head  *ic_idle_bh;
00493         unsigned int         ic_idle_failed:1; /* Idle block mechanism failed */
00494 };
00495 
00496 /*
00497  * description-specific part of iam_path. This is usually embedded into larger
00498  * structure.
00499  */
00500 struct iam_path_descr {
00501         /*
00502          * Scratch-pad area for temporary keys.
00503          */
00504         struct iam_ikey *ipd_key_scratch[DX_SCRATCH_KEYS];
00505 };
00506 
00507 /*
00508  * Structure to keep track of a path drilled through htree.
00509  */
00510 struct iam_path {
00511         /*
00512          * Parent container.
00513          */
00514         struct iam_container  *ip_container;
00515         /*
00516          * Number of index levels minus one.
00517          */
00518         int                    ip_indirect;
00519         /*
00520          * Nodes that top-to-bottom traversal passed through.
00521          */
00522         struct iam_frame       ip_frames[DX_MAX_TREE_HEIGHT];
00523         /*
00524          * Last filled frame in ->ip_frames. Refers to the 'twig' node (one
00525          * immediately above leaf).
00526          */
00527         struct iam_frame      *ip_frame;
00528         /*
00529          * Leaf node: a child of ->ip_frame.
00530          */
00531         struct iam_leaf        ip_leaf;
00532         /*
00533          * Key searched for.
00534          */
00535         const struct iam_key  *ip_key_target;
00536         const struct iam_ikey *ip_ikey_target;
00537         /*
00538          * Description-specific data.
00539          */
00540         struct iam_path_descr *ip_data;
00541 };
00542 
00543 struct ldiskfs_dx_hash_info;
00544 
00545 /*
00546  * Helper structure for legacy htrees.
00547  */
00548 struct iam_path_compat {
00549         struct iam_path      ipc_path;
00550         struct iam_container ipc_container;
00551         __u32                 ipc_scratch[DX_SCRATCH_KEYS];
00552         struct ldiskfs_dx_hash_info  *ipc_hinfo;
00553         struct qstr          *ipc_qstr;
00554         struct iam_path_descr ipc_descr;
00555         struct ldiskfs_dx_hash_info   ipc_hinfo_area;
00556 };
00557 
00558 #define const_max(p, q) ((p > q) ? p : q)
00559 
00560 enum {
00561         DX_MAX_IKEY_SIZE   = 32, /* be generous */
00562         /*
00563          * Hack to avoid dynamic allocation and freeing of ipd.
00564          */
00565         DX_IPD_MAX_SIZE    = const_max(sizeof(struct iam_path_compat),
00566                                        DX_MAX_IKEY_SIZE * DX_SCRATCH_KEYS +
00567                                        sizeof(struct iam_path_descr))
00568 };
00569 
00570 /*
00571  * iam cursor (iterator) api.
00572  */
00573 
00574 /*
00575  * States of iterator state machine.
00576  */
00577 enum iam_it_state {
00578         /* initial state */
00579         IAM_IT_DETACHED,
00580         /* iterator is above particular record in the container */
00581         IAM_IT_ATTACHED,
00582         /* iterator is positioned before record  */
00583         IAM_IT_SKEWED
00584 };
00585 
00586 /*
00587  * Flags controlling iterator functionality.
00588  */
00589 enum iam_it_flags {
00590         /*
00591          * this iterator will move (iam_it_next() will be called on it)
00592          */
00593         IAM_IT_MOVE  = (1 << 0),
00594         /*
00595          * tree can be updated through this iterator.
00596          */
00597         IAM_IT_WRITE = (1 << 1)
00598 };
00599 
00600 /*
00601  * Iterator.
00602  *
00603  * Immediately after call to iam_it_init() iterator is in "detached"
00604  * (IAM_IT_DETACHED) state: it is associated with given parent container, but
00605  * doesn't point to any particular record in this container.
00606  *
00607  * After successful call to iam_it_get() and until corresponding call to
00608  * iam_it_put() iterator is in one of "active" states: IAM_IT_ATTACHED or
00609  * IAM_IT_SKEWED.
00610  *
00611  * Active iterator can move through records in a container (provided
00612  * IAM_IT_MOVE permission) in a key order, can get record and key values as it
00613  * passes over them, and can modify container (provided IAM_IT_WRITE
00614  * permission).
00615  *
00616  * Iteration may reach the end of container, at which point iterator switches
00617  * into IAM_IT_DETACHED state.
00618  *
00619  * Concurrency: iterators are supposed to be local to thread. Interfaces below
00620  * do no internal serialization of access to the iterator fields.
00621  *
00622  * When in non-detached state, iterator keeps some container nodes pinned in
00623  * memory and locked (that locking may be implemented at the container
00624  * granularity though). In particular, clients may assume that pointers to
00625  * records and keys obtained through iterator interface as valid until
00626  * iterator is detached (except that they may be invalidated by sub-sequent
00627  * operations done through the same iterator).
00628  *
00629  */
00630 struct iam_iterator {
00631         /*
00632          * iterator flags, taken from enum iam_it_flags.
00633          */
00634         __u32                 ii_flags;
00635         enum iam_it_state     ii_state;
00636         /*
00637          * path to the record. Valid in IAM_IT_ATTACHED, and IAM_IT_SKEWED
00638          * states.
00639          */
00640         struct iam_path       ii_path;
00641 };
00642 
00643 void iam_path_init(struct iam_path *path, struct iam_container *c,
00644                    struct iam_path_descr *pd);
00645 void iam_path_fini(struct iam_path *path);
00646 void iam_path_release(struct iam_path *path);
00647 
00648 void iam_path_compat_init(struct iam_path_compat *path, struct inode *inode);
00649 void iam_path_compat_fini(struct iam_path_compat *path);
00650 
00651 struct iam_path_descr *iam_ipd_alloc(void *area, int keysize);
00652 void iam_ipd_free(struct iam_path_descr *ipd);
00653 
00654 int  iam_it_init(struct iam_iterator *it, struct iam_container *c, __u32 flags,
00655                  struct iam_path_descr *pd);
00656 void iam_it_fini(struct iam_iterator *it);
00657 int iam_it_get(struct iam_iterator *it, const struct iam_key *k);
00658 int iam_it_get_at(struct iam_iterator *it, const struct iam_key *k);
00659 void iam_it_dup(struct iam_iterator *dst, const struct iam_iterator *src);
00660 void iam_it_put(struct iam_iterator *it);
00661 int iam_it_next(struct iam_iterator *it);
00662 struct iam_rec *iam_it_rec_get(const struct iam_iterator *it);
00663 int iam_it_rec_set(handle_t *h,

00668                       const struct iam_key *k, const struct iam_rec *r);

00700 static inline struct iam_descr *iam_container_descr(struct iam_container *c)
00701 {
00702         return c->ic_descr;

00705 static inline struct iam_descr *iam_path_descr(const struct iam_path *p)
00706 {
00707         return p->ip_container->ic_descr;
00708 }

00712         return p->ip_container->ic_object;

00715 static inline void iam_ikeycpy(const struct iam_container *c,
00716                                struct iam_ikey *k1, const struct iam_ikey *k2)
00717 {
00718         memcpy(k1, k2, c->ic_descr->id_ikey_size);
00719 }
00720 
00721 static inline size_t iam_entry_size(struct iam_path *p)
00722 {
00723         return iam_path_descr(p)->id_ikey_size + iam_path_descr(p)->id_ptr_size;
00724 }
00725 
00726 static inline struct iam_entry *iam_entry_shift(struct iam_path *p,
00727                                                 struct iam_entry *entry,
00728                                                 int shift)
00729 {
00730         void *e = entry;
00731         return e + shift * iam_entry_size(p);
00732 }
00733 
00734 static inline struct iam_ikey *dx_get_ikey(struct iam_path *p,
00735                                             struct iam_entry *entry,
00736                                             struct iam_ikey *key)
00737 {
00738         return memcpy(key, entry, iam_path_descr(p)->id_ikey_size);
00739 }
00740 
00741 static inline struct iam_ikey *iam_ikey_at(struct iam_path *p,
00742                                            struct iam_entry *entry)
00743 {
00744         return (struct iam_ikey *)entry;
00745 }
00746 
00747 static inline ptrdiff_t iam_entry_diff(struct iam_path *p,
00748                                        struct iam_entry *e1,
00749                                        struct iam_entry *e2)
00750 {
00751         ptrdiff_t diff;
00752 
00753         diff = (void *)e1 - (void *)e2;
00754         assert_corr(diff / iam_entry_size(p) * iam_entry_size(p) == diff);
00755         return diff / iam_entry_size(p);
00756 }
00757 
00758 /*
00759  * Helper for the frequent case, where key was already placed into @k1 by
00760  * callback.
00761  */
00762 static inline void iam_ikeycpy0(const struct iam_container *c,
00763                                 struct iam_ikey *k1, const struct iam_ikey *k2)
00764 {
00765         if (k1 != k2)
00766                 iam_ikeycpy(c, k1, k2);
00767 }
00768 
00769 static inline int iam_ikeycmp(const struct iam_container *c,
00770                               const struct iam_ikey *k1,
00771                               const struct iam_ikey *k2)
00772 {
00773         return c->ic_descr->id_ops->id_ikeycmp(c, k1, k2);
00774 }
00775 
00776 static inline void *iam_entry_off(struct iam_entry *entry, size_t off)
00777 {
00778         return (void *)((char *)entry + off);
00779 }

00813 /*XXX These stuff put here, just because they are used by iam.c */
00814 static inline unsigned dx_get_block(struct iam_path *p, struct iam_entry *entry)
00815 {
00816         u32 *addr;
00817 
00818         addr = iam_entry_off(entry, iam_path_descr(p)->id_ikey_size);
00819         return le32_to_cpu(get_unaligned(addr));
00820 }
00821 
00822 static inline void dx_set_block(struct iam_path *p,
00823                                 struct iam_entry *entry, unsigned value)
00824 {
00825         u32 *addr;
00826 
00827         addr = iam_entry_off(entry, iam_path_descr(p)->id_ikey_size);
00828         put_unaligned(cpu_to_le32(value), addr);
00829 }
00830 
00831 static inline void dx_set_ikey(struct iam_path *p, struct iam_entry *entry,
00832                                const struct iam_ikey *key)
00833 {
00834         iam_ikeycpy(p->ip_container, iam_entry_off(entry, 0), key);
00835 }

00837 struct dx_map_entry

00839         u32 hash;
00840         u32 offs;
00841 };

00843 struct fake_dirent {
00844         __le32 inode;
00845         __le16 rec_len;
00846         u8 name_len;
00847         u8 file_type;
00848 };
00849 
00850 struct dx_countlimit {
00851         __le16 limit;
00852         __le16 count;
00853 };
00854 
00855 /*
00856  * dx_root_info is laid out so that if it should somehow get overlaid by a
00857  * dirent the two low bits of the hash version will be zero.  Therefore, the
00858  * hash version mod 4 should never be 0.  Sincerely, the paranoia department.
00859  */
00860 
00861 struct dx_root {
00862         struct fake_dirent dot;
00863         char dot_name[4];
00864         struct fake_dirent dotdot;
00865         char dotdot_name[4];
00866         struct dx_root_info
00867         {
00868                 __le32 reserved_zero;
00869                 u8 hash_version;
00870                 u8 info_length; /* 8 */
00871                 u8 indirect_levels;
00872                 u8 unused_flags;
00873         }
00874         info;
00875         struct {} entries[0];
00876 };
00877 
00878 struct dx_node
00879 {
00880         struct fake_dirent fake;
00881         struct {} entries[0];
00882 };
00883 
00884 
00885 static inline unsigned dx_get_count(struct iam_entry *entries)
00886 {
00887         return le16_to_cpu(((struct dx_countlimit *) entries)->count);
00888 }
00889 
00890 static inline unsigned dx_get_limit(struct iam_entry *entries)
00891 {
00892         return le16_to_cpu(((struct dx_countlimit *) entries)->limit);
00893 }
00894 
00895 static inline void dx_set_count(struct iam_entry *entries, unsigned value)
00896 {
00897         ((struct dx_countlimit *) entries)->count = cpu_to_le16(value);
00898 }
00899 
00900 static inline unsigned dx_node_limit(struct iam_path *p)
00901 {
00902         struct iam_descr *param = iam_path_descr(p);
00903         unsigned entry_space   = iam_path_obj(p)->i_sb->s_blocksize -
00904                 param->id_node_gap;
00905         return entry_space / (param->id_ikey_size + param->id_ptr_size);
00906 }
00907 
00908 static inline unsigned dx_root_limit(struct iam_path *p)
00909 {
00910         struct iam_descr *param = iam_path_descr(p);
00911         unsigned limit = iam_path_obj(p)->i_sb->s_blocksize -
00912                 param->id_root_gap;
00913         limit /= (param->id_ikey_size + param->id_ptr_size);
00914         if (limit == dx_node_limit(p))
00915                 limit--;
00916         return limit;
00917 }
00918 
00919 
00920 static inline struct iam_entry *dx_get_entries(struct iam_path *path,
00921                                                void *data, int root)
00922 {
00923         struct iam_descr *param = iam_path_descr(path);
00924         return data + (root ? param->id_root_gap : param->id_node_gap);
00925 }
00926 
00927 
00928 static inline struct iam_entry *dx_node_get_entries(struct iam_path *path,
00929                                                     struct iam_frame *frame)
00930 {
00931         return dx_get_entries(path,
00932                               frame->bh->b_data, frame == path->ip_frames);
00933 }
00934 
00935 static inline struct iam_ikey *iam_path_ikey(const struct iam_path *path,
00936                                              int nr)
00937 {
00938         LASSERT(0 <= nr && nr < ARRAY_SIZE(path->ip_data->ipd_key_scratch));
00939         return path->ip_data->ipd_key_scratch[nr];
00940 }
00941 
00942 static inline int iam_leaf_is_locked(const struct iam_leaf *leaf)
00943 {
00944         int result;
00945 
00946         result = dynlock_is_locked(&iam_leaf_container(leaf)->ic_tree_lock,
00947                                    leaf->il_curidx);
00948         if (!result)
00949                 dump_stack();
00950         return result;
00951 }
00952 
00953 static inline int iam_frame_is_locked(struct iam_path *path,
00954                                       const struct iam_frame *frame)
00955 {
00956         int result;
00957 
00958         result = dynlock_is_locked(&path->ip_container->ic_tree_lock,
00959                                    frame->curidx);
00960         if (!result)
00961                 dump_stack();
00962         return result;
00963 }

01013 #ifndef swap
01014 #define swap(x, y) do { typeof(x) z = x; x = y; y = z; } while (0)
01015 #endif
01016 
01017 #ifdef DX_DEBUG
01018 #define dxtrace(command) command
01019 #else
01020 #define dxtrace(command) 
01021 #endif
01022 
01023 #define BH_DXLock        (BH_BITMAP_UPTODATE + 1)
01024 #define DX_DEBUG (0)
01025 #if DX_DEBUG
01026 static struct iam_lock_stats {
01027         unsigned dls_bh_lock;
01028         unsigned dls_bh_busy;
01029         unsigned dls_bh_again;
01030         unsigned dls_bh_full_again;
01031 } iam_lock_stats = { 0, };
01032 #define DX_DEVAL(x) x
01033 #else
01034 #define DX_DEVAL(x)
01035 #endif
01036 
01037 static inline void iam_lock_bh(struct buffer_head volatile *bh)
01038 {
01039         DX_DEVAL(iam_lock_stats.dls_bh_lock++);
01040 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
01041         while (test_and_set_bit(BH_DXLock, &bh->b_state)) {
01042                 DX_DEVAL(iam_lock_stats.dls_bh_busy++);
01043                 while (test_bit(BH_DXLock, &bh->b_state))
01044                         cpu_relax();
01045         }
01046 #endif
01047 }
01048 
01049 static inline void iam_unlock_bh(struct buffer_head *bh)
01050 {
01051 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
01052         smp_mb__before_clear_bit();
01053         clear_bit(BH_DXLock, &bh->b_state);
01054 #endif
01055 }

01079 /*
01080  * Container format.
01081  */
01082 struct iam_format {
01083         /*
01084          * Method called to recognize container format. Should return true iff
01085          * container @c conforms to this format. This method may do IO to read
01086          * container pages.
01087          *
01088          * If container is recognized, this method sets operation vectors
01089          * ->id_ops and ->id_leaf_ops in container description (c->ic_descr),
01090          * and fills other description fields.
01091          */
01092         int (*if_guess)(struct iam_container *c);
01093         /*
01094          * Linkage into global list of container formats.
01095          */
01096         struct list_head if_linkage;
01097 };
01098

01100 int iam_root_limit(int rootgap, int blocksize, int size);

01154 };
01155 
01156 enum iam_ioctl_cmd {
01157         IAM_IOC_INIT     = _IOW('i', 1, struct iam_uapi_info),
01158         IAM_IOC_GETINFO  = _IOR('i', 2, struct iam_uapi_info),
01159         IAM_IOC_INSERT   = _IOR('i', 3, struct iam_uapi_op),
01160         IAM_IOC_LOOKUP   = _IOWR('i', 4, struct iam_uapi_op),
01161         IAM_IOC_DELETE   = _IOR('i', 5, struct iam_uapi_op),
01162         IAM_IOC_IT_START = _IOR('i', 6, struct iam_uapi_it),
01163         IAM_IOC_IT_NEXT  = _IOW('i', 7, struct iam_uapi_it),
01164         IAM_IOC_IT_STOP  = _IOR('i', 8, struct iam_uapi_it),
01165 
01166         IAM_IOC_POLYMORPH = _IOR('i', 9, unsigned long)
01167 };
